messages.content:
You are a systematic literature review (SLR) screening assistant.


DOMAIN: AI/ML/DL applications in ophthalmology and eye diseases.

RELEVANT DISEASES:
- Diabetic Retinopathy
- Glaucoma
- Cataract
- Age-related Macular Degeneration (AMD)
- Retinal disorders (retinopathy, retinal detachment, etc.)
- Ophthalmic conditions (keratoconus, dry eye, etc.)
- Any eye/vision-related diseases

RELEVANT TASKS:
- Diagnosis
- Detection
- Classification
- Severity grading
- Prediction
- Segmentation
- Screening

RELEVANT METHODS:
- Artificial Intelligence (AI)
- Machine Learning (ML)
- Deep Learning (DL)
- Neural Networks (CNN, RNN, Transformers, etc.)
- Computer Vision
- Image Analysis


================================================================================
TASK: Evaluate this paper ABSTRACT for inclusion.
(This paper passed title screening)
================================================================================

TITLE: ML-Unet: Performing Retinal Segmentation by Integrating Frequency Domain Information
ABSTRACT: Retinal vessel segmentation is very important for the clinical diagnosis of various common eye diseases. Therefore, the use of computer vision model for vascular automatic segmentation has attracted more and more attention. However, there are individual differences in blood vessel morphology, and background noise in fundus images can blur the tiny blood vessels, leading to segmentation difficulties. To solve these problems, we propose a new ML-net method, which improves U-net by integrating frequency-domain information. Wavelet transform and fast Fourier transform are used to decompose the image into different frequency components. Then the high frequency information and low frequency information are processed respectively, so as to realize the filtering and optimization of the original image. In addition, Gabor filters are integrated into the original network to assist the convolutional neural network in feature extraction. Experiments on DRIVE and CHASE_DB1 datasets demonstrate the effectiveness of the proposed method.

================================================================================
SELECTION RULES (BE INCLUSIVE - DO NOT MISS RELEVANT PAPERS):
================================================================================

OUTPUT: Abstract_Selected
IF ANY of the following is TRUE:
- Abstract confirms AI/ML/DL method for eye disease
- Abstract describes automated diagnosis/detection for ophthalmology
- Abstract mentions dataset of retinal/fundus/OCT images with ML analysis
- Abstract is UNCLEAR but suggests AI application in eye care
- Abstract describes deep learning model for any eye condition

OUTPUT: Abstract_Deleted
ONLY IF the abstract CLEARLY confirms:
- This is a review/survey/meta-analysis paper (not primary research)
- No AI/ML/DL methodology is used at all
- The disease is NOT eye-related
- The paper is editorial/commentary/opinion only

================================================================================
IMPORTANT: When abstract is missing or unclear, SELECT (Abstract_Selected).
We prefer false positives over missing relevant papers.
================================================================================

OUTPUT: Respond with EXACTLY one label only (no explanation):
Abstract_Selected
OR
Abstract_Deleted

YOUR RESPONSE:
